level.heading: FORM OF DOCUMENTS ELECTRONICALLY FILED (ยง 27-405)

level.text: Format of Electronically Filed Documents. All electronically filed pleadings shall, to the extent practicable, be formatted in accordance with the applicable rules governing formatting of paper pleadings, and in such other and further format as the Board may require from time to time.

Representations by Using a Typographical Signature. Every pleading, document, and instrument electronically filed shall be deemed to have been signed by the attorney or declarant and shall bear a facsimile or typographical signature of such person, along with the typed name, address, telephone number, and Bar number of a signing attorney. Typographical signatures shall be styled “/s/ name” and shall be treated as personal signatures for all purposes under these Rules.
Electronic Title of Pleadings and Other Documents. The electronic title of each electronically filed pleading or other document (“papers”), shall include:
Party or parties filing the paper;
Party or parties against whom relief, if any, is sought; and
Nature of the relief sought (e.g., “Appellant’s Motion to Compel Discovery and for Sanctions against Appellee”).
